TopicTitle: Mod for making clustered engines act as one part?

Articles.Content: I saw on a YT video a couple days ago someone that was using a mod that let them build clusters of engines that the game then treated as one part. Now I can't seem to find that video again to look up what it's called. Anybody know?

Or this...

SSTULabs - Low Part Count Solutions (Orbiter, Landers, Lifters) - Dev Thread [01-30-16] - Add-on Development - Kerbal Space Program Forums

 -- has a plugin where you can create engine clusters from any engine model (including stock models).  Includes options for various mounts, engine layouts, and full RF/RO support.

Disclaimer:  I am the author.  Oh, and it -is- still supported

1 hour ago, Shadowmage said:

Or this...

SSTULabs - Low Part Count Solutions (Orbiter, Landers, Lifters) - Dev Thread [01-30-16] - Add-on Development - Kerbal Space Program Forums

 -- has a plugin where you can create engine clusters from any engine model (including stock models).  Includes options for various mounts, engine layouts, and full RF/RO support.

Disclaimer:  I am the author.  Oh, and it -is- still supported

 

Bingo! That's it, thanks so much! Been playing RO/RP0 lately and starting to get into the realm of 20+ engines firing at launch. I'm hoping this will cut down on some lag at launch time. The guy using it in the YT video claimed it helped him at least. As far as part welding, I do have that mod but I barely use it since it bugs out with proc parts, of which I use plenty.

4 hours ago, pearldrumbum said:

The guy using it in the YT video claimed it helped him at least. As far as part welding, I do have that mod but I barely use it since it bugs out with proc parts, of which I use plenty.

Why do you need some many engines firing?
I cant speak for the op, but i often find a cluster of small engines can have a better isp for a given twr value. Havent needed 20+ yet though...
